page.title: 07Sham Farm,East Sussex.
page.content: Sham Farm gets its name from a wall that was built there to hide imposing farm buildings.When the wall was built it was supposed to make the farm look like a very large house when viewed from Eridge Castle. Sham Farm is an arable farm and crops such as wheat,barley,oats and oil seed rape are grown.In September the farmer sows his seeds and culivates the land with disc harrows. In January,June and December the hedges are cut and the machinery checked and serviced.They have quite a lot of machinery at Sham Farm.They have one very large tractor.They also have a machine for spraying fertiliser on the fields.They have two ploughs which they don't use now because a plough disturbs the soil too much.In summer they use a large combine harvester to harvest the crops.
